dcterms:creator: L.-J. Lin
dcterms:description: Experience Replay refers to the use of rehearsal strategies in reinforcement learning settings, which has shown promising results in robotics and complex environments.
dcterms:title: Experience Replay

dcterms:creator: A. Robins
dcterms:description: Pseudorehearsal is a method that does not require explicit storage of patterns, using generative models to create pseudopatterns that assist in training.
dcterms:title: Pseudorehearsal

dcterms:creator: M. McCloskey
N. J. Cohen
dcterms:description: Catastrophic Forgetting refers to the phenomenon where previously learned information is lost when new information is learned, particularly in connectionist networks.
dcterms:title: Catastrophic Forgetting

dcterms:creator: J. L. McClelland

dcterms:description: Dual Network Models are inspired by biological learning systems and provide insights into the complementary learning systems in the brain.
dcterms:title: Dual Network Models

dcterms:description: BioDynaMo is a platform for large-scale reproducible biological simulations, aimed at advancing biological research through simulation.
dcterms:title: BioDynaMo
